When you look at a map for your present area, you can see the lay of the land, as well as your current location.≺Prompt≻
Members of your party will appear on the map, too. Also, certain jobs let you track people and monsters on them.≺Prompt≻
They're especially handy because you can mark where you've been, and some people can mark them for you as well.≺Prompt≻

Welcome, Master! This is your home, the “Mog House,” kupo!≺Prompt≻
I'm a moogle! We moogles like taking care of houses and items! Nice to meet you, kupo!≺Prompt≻
I'll tell you all about your Mog House, kupo!≺Prompt≻
First, the basics, kupo! Open your main menu, Master. The button at the very bottom changes to “Mog House” when you're in your Mog House, kupo!≺Prompt≻
Press it and the “Mog House” menu will appear! Everything you can do in your Mog House is there, kupo!≺Prompt≻
There are lots of things you can do in your Mog House, kupo! It can be too much for some masters, kupo...≺Prompt≻
So I'll teach you about each one of them! Ask me what you want to know about, kupo!≺Prompt≻
Choose the Mog House command you want to know about, kupo!≺Prompt≻
What do you want to know about? ≺Selection Dialog≻The Mog Safe. Storage. The Delivery Box. Changing jobs. Gardening. Changing the layout. Mog House invitations. I got it, thanks, kupo!≺Prompt≻
The Mog Safe is where I keep items that you can't carry! It's an especially secure and solid safe, kupo!≺Prompt≻
You can only put so many items in it, kupo... But I'll guard them even if it means my life, kupo!≺Prompt≻
The Delivery Box is where you can send letters to friends and receive items from various places, kupo!≺Prompt≻
You should take the items from your Delivery Box and put them in your inventory when they arrive, kupo!≺Prompt≻
If your Delivery Box is full, no more deliveries can be made, and you can't send any mail either, kupo!≺Prompt≻
You can send items and gil to your friends with the “Send” command, kupo!≺Prompt≻
(Sometimes, if a special force takes hold, you can even deliver items with the "Exclusive" attribute, kupo...!)≺Prompt≻
Changing people's jobs is a secret ability only we moogles can use, kupo!≺Prompt≻
I take off all your equipment and take you to a mysterious place, kupo!≺Prompt≻
And...the rest is a secret, kupo!≺Prompt≻
All moogles like taking care of plants, kupo!≺Prompt≻
As long as you have a flowerpot and seeds, I'll make it my personal responsibility to look after the plants you raise, kupo!≺Prompt≻
This Mog House is your very own room, kupo! But it's still a little bare, kupo...≺Prompt≻
It needs some furniture and maybe some paintings to make it more cozy, kupo!≺Prompt≻
If you find any during your travels, I'll help you lay them out, kupo! I can't wait, kupo!≺Prompt≻
Storage space becomes available when you place furniture in your Mog House using the “Layout” command, kupo!≺Prompt≻
It's almost exactly the same as using your Mog Safe, kupo! Leave your items here for me to look after, kupo!≺Prompt≻
You can invite party and alliance members into your Mog House, kupo!≺Prompt≻
You can show off your expensive furniture, have tea parties, plan your next great adventure--the possibilities are endless, kupo!≺Prompt≻

It all began with a raindrop, or so the legend says...≺Prompt≻
Master! Oh, master, look! We've sprung a leak, kupo! Just look at it drip, drip, dripping away!≺Prompt≻
What a terribly troubling turn of events, kupo! But have no fear! Sit tight and you'll see why I'm the most renowned handymoogle in the three nations!≺Prompt≻
Goddess have mercy on my moogle soul. Look at this mess! Rotting roof boards! Rusted nails, kupo!≺Prompt≻
Why, it's a miracle this tottering, tumble-down shanty--I mean, this beautiful abode of yours--is still standing, master!≺Prompt≻
Anyhow, this simply won't do, kupo. We must make repairs before we have water up to my little wings!≺Prompt≻

I figure all I'll need is a good ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻#≺BAD CHAR: 8280≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻, ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 01≻ ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻$ａ≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻, and ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 01≻ ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻$ｂ≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻ to have this fixed up good as new, kupo!≺Prompt≻
Could I trouble you to track them down? While you're out, I'll patch up the other problem spots.≺Prompt≻
And do hurry, Master! Lest you return to find your poor moogle friend lying prostrate in a pernicious puddle of rainwater, kupo...≺Prompt≻
Thank you, Master, but our leak is in another Mog House! Bring this to me when we're back home in ≺Multiple Choice (Parameter 0)≻[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst], won't you, kupo?≺Prompt≻

You've found them, kupo! I knew I could count on you. That's what I tell all my moogle buddies. “Why, my master is the boldest, brightest, bestest master of them all!” Now we just take these, and...≺Prompt≻
Kupoooooo～there you have it! Better than new! Why, a bevy of wild buffalo could barge in here this second and it wouldn't budge an ilm, I say!≺Prompt≻
Which reminds me, I went ahead and relayed the requisite reports to my manager at the MHMU.≺Prompt≻
But wouldn't you know it, kupo? It seems there's been a trifling bit of trouble at one of our Rent-a-Rooms in Jeuno as well!≺Prompt≻
You know the one, right across from Durable Shields. Whatever could have gone wrong, kupo?≺Prompt≻
Well, there's nothing to be learned lollygagging around here. Come, Master, we're off to Jeuno!≺Prompt≻

And I couldn't see Audia suffer anymore. Please, forgive me!≺Prompt≻
I...≺Prompt≻

Audia, Albrecht ventured into the maw of peril to find a cure for you. Now, I want you to try hard and get better!≺Prompt≻

Audia!≺Prompt≻

You bet I'll sign! Also, here's a secret: Galmut used to have a crush on my sister!≺Prompt≻
Oh, hello there. You won't find anything here but memories long gone. Young, sprightly folk like yourself would likely die of boredom!≺Prompt≻
Hello. I always come and help Ilumida. She has problems with her back, and really can't live on her own anymore.≺Prompt≻
The war may be over, but the pain is everlasting. Ilumida lost her husband, and people like her suffer each and every day.≺Prompt≻
Jeuno seems like a lively place, but look deeper and you'll find scars that linger. War is indeed a terrible thing.≺Prompt≻

I wonder who that could be. Excuse me, please.≺Prompt≻

Always at your service, madam.≺Prompt≻
Wolfgang's father, Brandolf, was a soldier, too. He fought for Jeuno's freedom long before the archduke's reign.≺Prompt≻
And my husband served under him. But in the wars that followed... When he was about Wolfgang's age...≺Prompt≻
His father, Brandolf, died from wounds he received in battle. Before he died, he ordered funds to be paid out to people like me.≺Prompt≻
Well, who am I to lecture about this to a stranger? I'm sorry.≺Prompt≻
Well, now I suppose I must go give word.≺Prompt≻
I thought there was a candle around here...≺Prompt≻
Oh, dear... It seems I'm right out of candles!≺Prompt≻
Would you mind running to the temple and picking one up for me? At my age, even short walks leave me quite out of breath.≺Prompt≻
Will you bring ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻6ｇ≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻? ≺Selection Dialog≻At once. Not yet.≺Prompt≻

It's not much, but I believe it will watch over you in times of need. Come, don't be shy... Take it!≺Prompt≻
It's been so long since my husband died in the war. This was a small house for two of us, and it's always seemed so big with just me.≺Prompt≻
Well, feel free to stop by if you're ever in the neighborhood. I've always got a pot of tea ready for company.≺Prompt≻

Long ago, the Goddess Altana took pity on the barren world of Vana'diel and shed five tears. Our ancestors sprouted from each one.≺Prompt≻
But the god Promathia saw this, and condemned her work. He cursed all her people to eternal conflict among each other.≺Prompt≻
Altana would not be pleased to see us now, squabbling over our petty causes. Please, at least while you are here, shun conflict and pray for peace.≺Prompt≻
The candles made here are blessed with a special prayer: “May this holy light cleanse the world of shadow.”≺Prompt≻
Say, you here for business? This town's a mecca for merchants, you know, since all roads lead to Jeuno!≺Prompt≻
People come full of hope, with great dreams and plans for the future. Our free city is a melting pot for all mankind!≺Prompt≻
But not everybody. Some just pick up and head for home. Where there is light, there is shadow. That's Jeuno!≺Prompt≻

So whenever you're there, you can talk with your peers... You know? I always have a blast, so try it outaru!≺Prompt≻
I've never lost a fight here. This town is full of wimps!≺Prompt≻

Everrryone's proud of its accuracy. It's so cutting-edge!≺Prompt≻
Welcome to Upper Jeuno! This neighborhood lacks pizzaz, but more than makes up for it with its great industrial enterprises.≺Prompt≻
A lot of stubborn people live here, but don't worry, since they're nice once you get to know them.≺Prompt≻

The master of this chocobo stable is famous! It is an honor to ride a bird here.≺Prompt≻

So many people greeted us warmly in our journeys together. They laughed with us, and cheered for us.≺Prompt≻
Nothing about their joy was false. And hearing them was my greatest happiness. But I have forgotten that, and now I cling to the past.≺Prompt≻
If you were here... If only you were here, I could relive the happiness of those days.≺Prompt≻
Hello. Head to the counter for service.≺Prompt≻
I was hired to craft armor for this shop, but all I ever do is watch over the inventory.≺Prompt≻
I wanted to hone my skills repairing armor. But boy, was I wrong! Armor is never repaired anymore, it's replaced!≺Prompt≻
Not so with the works of old! No, they were precious, and were often kept for generations.≺Prompt≻
Of those, the most famous were the Lost Hands of Borghertz. You have heard of Borghertz, haven't you?≺Prompt≻
Do you want to hear about Borghertz? ≺Selection Dialog≻Yes, tell me. No, thank you.≺Prompt≻
Thirty years ago, the legendary craftsman Borghertz wrought gauntlets, one pair for each job.≺Prompt≻
So great was his craft, they say he must have sold his spirit to fiends. His gauntlets were strong as steel, but light as a feather!≺Prompt≻
But, those masterpieces were lost in the great war twenty years ago.≺Prompt≻
Oh? It seems all adventurers know of him and his gauntlets.≺Prompt≻
Of course, it's all hearsay. Much is told of Borghertz, but most of it is just legend.≺Prompt≻
I once met a man who found a pair of Borghertz's gauntlets. And where there's smoke, there's fire.≺Prompt≻

The hands of Borghertz were lost in the war, but people say they now rest somewhere in ≺Multiple Choice (Parameter 7)≻[a dungeon somewhere/the Eldieme Necropolis/the Crawlers' Nest/Beadeaux/Garlaige Citadel/the Eldieme Necropolis/Davoi/the Eldieme Necropolis/the Eldieme Necropolis/the Crawlers' Nest/Castle Zvahl/Garlaige Citadel/the Kuftal Tunnel/Ifrit's Cauldron/the Boyahda Tree/the Sea Serpent Grotto].≺Prompt≻

That's about all I know. You can go search that dungeon for yourself if you've got nothing better to do.≺Prompt≻
We artisans believe that artifacts like the hands of Borghertz still rest in dungeons across Vana'diel. An adventurer like you should be able to find them.≺Prompt≻
Much is told of Borghertz, but it's all just a legend. Don't let greed cloud your judgment.≺Prompt≻
Could it be!? Why, they're soiled and rusty, but the craftsmanship! Indeed these are the work of Borghertz!≺Prompt≻
But they are beyond my skill. I cannot repair them.≺Prompt≻
Wait. I heard that a Mithra working for the Tenshodo acquired a strange toolbox long ago.≺Prompt≻

You found the gauntlets? Amazing!≺Prompt≻
So, I have seen the hands of Borghertz. I'm glad I work here now!≺Prompt≻
I must strive for greatness, too! Someday I'll be known as a legendary craftsman!≺Prompt≻

What is your business? ≺Selection Dialog≻Would you cast Signet on me? I want to spend my conquest points. ≺Multiple Choice (Parameter 0)≻[I want to join the Expeditionary Force./Teleport me to the E.F. area.] I want to quit the E.F./change my E.F. I want to go on a supplies quest. I have some questions... Nothing, sorry to bother you.≺Prompt≻

What do you wish to know about? ≺Selection Dialog≻Nothing. Conquests. Conquest results. Donating crystals. Conquest points. The effects of controlling regions. Regions controlled by other nations. Regions under beastman control.≺Prompt≻

All three nations are striving daily to put more regions under their control. This is what we call “conquests.” You can take part in it and serve your country by defeating enemies while you have Signet cast on you.≺Prompt≻
Each region comprises several areas, and the nation that rids those areas of the most monsters gains control of the region.≺Prompt≻
Nations receive goods and resources from regions under their control.≺Prompt≻
So, the more regions we control, the richer our nation becomes.≺Prompt≻
Border guards are also placed in outposts within regions under our control. They are there to cast Signet on adventurers like yourself.≺Prompt≻
Once you have your nation's Signet, you will be able to acquire crystals from enemies you defeat.≺Prompt≻

Not only that, but you will also receive conquest points. You get more conquest points if you defeat enemies in regions that are not under your nation's control. These points can be used to purchase items from guards like myself.≺Prompt≻
So you see...conquests benefit nations and adventurers alike. We expect you to do your best to serve your country.≺Prompt≻

You can see the current state of conquests by selecting “Region Info” from the main menu. Conquest results in all regions are regularly recalculated, so you may want to check them from time to time.≺Prompt≻
Shops in our city will be selling different items according to our conquest rank. The Troupe Valeriano will also visit the nation that finishes first and bring a little joy to its citizens.≺Prompt≻
You can donate crystals to your nation once you achieve rank 2. Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.≺Prompt≻
We would like you to donate crystals to your nation from now on. Just trade them to guards like myself, and we will ensure they are sent to the proper place.≺Prompt≻
You can acquire crystals by defeating enemies while you have your nation's Signet. Having Signet cast on you is also the only way of taking part in conquests.≺Prompt≻
Rank points will be awarded to you for each crystal you donate, and you may be offered new missions as your rank goes up.≺Prompt≻
You also receive rank points for completing missions. Complete missions and take part in conquests to raise your rank and serve your country.≺Prompt≻
You are awarded conquest points when you defeat monsters while you are taking part in conquests. Select "Region Info" from the menu to check your current number of conquest points.≺Prompt≻
You can purchase items from guards like myself with your conquest points, but be warned that the number of points you spend will be subtracted from your current total.≺Prompt≻

When conquest results are announced, you will be told which country controls the region you are in at that time. Sometimes regions may become neutral, or beastmen may even gain control of regions.≺Prompt≻
If we gain control of a region, border guards will be placed at its outposts to help adventurers like you.≺Prompt≻
Merchants will also be placed there, and goods from that region will find their way to the local shops here.≺Prompt≻
Gaining control of regions is the basic principle behind conquests. We need each of you to do your best, and bring our nation to the top of the ranks.≺Prompt≻
Of course, sometimes we lose regions to other nations...so we must try to take them back before the next conquest results are announced.≺Prompt≻
As an incentive, we will award you with more conquest points for defeating monsters in those regions.≺Prompt≻

But if we are allied with another nation, you will only be awarded the regular rate for defeating monsters in our allies' regions. On the other hand, we will award you with more points for fighting in the top-ranked nation's regions.≺Prompt≻
Our paramount concern lies in the beastmen gaining control of our regions. If too many of us are defeated in a region, the beastmen will gain control of it.≺Prompt≻
If this happens, not only is it a great blow to our pride, but you will be unable to acquire any crystals in that region.≺Prompt≻
The beastmen are a menace to all nations. If they rise to power, we must all unite and drive those vile creatures from that region.≺Prompt≻
We need you to bring supplies to the outpost border guards who are placed in regions under our control.≺Prompt≻
There is one outpost in each region. Select “Region Info” from the menu, and look for the areas with a small flag mark on the map. That is where they are.≺Prompt≻

Here are the supplies. Just give them to the guard at the outpost and your mission will be complete. Now, choose which outpost you want to go to. We give different rewards for each region, so choose carefully.≺Prompt≻

The minstrel of melodies is my name, For a mere ≺Numeric Parameter 6≻ gil I'll recall your past. Your stories of love, anger, triumph, and shame, The river of memories runs deep and vast.≺Prompt≻
The minstrel of melodies is my name, For a mere ≺Numeric Parameter 6≻ gil I'd recall your past. But I find that you're lacking in cash or in fame, So until that time, my kind offer will last.≺Prompt≻
Now close your eyes...≺Prompt≻
Good day, young adventurer. Would you mind having a spot of tea with an old woman? I could use some company.≺Prompt≻
You see this small chest? It was given to me by my late husband, Goddess bless his soul.≺Prompt≻
But look at it. It is fairly old, the craftsmanship is not that remarkable, and on top of that, it is locked. Not the kind of gift you would think of giving a loved one, eh? Heh heh heh...≺Prompt≻
This is the only present I ever got from my husband. I can still remember the day he gave it to me... “Here.” That is all he said... He never was good with words.≺Prompt≻
But I still treasure this chest with my life... You must think I am crazy to hold on to something so useless for so long.≺Prompt≻
Excusey-woozy me. Is anybody-buddy home?≺Prompt≻
Oh, and who might you be, my little friend?≺Prompt≻
My name is Kurou-Morou the Magnificentaru. I am the proprietor of the most reliable-viable astrological services in all of Jeuno.≺Prompt≻

So you're the guy Aldo was talking about...≺Prompt≻
Well, I guess the more the merrier, right? We'll meet you at the Tenshodo when you're ready to go.≺Prompt≻
Understood!≺Prompt≻
Oh, and you, ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻
I'll be holding on to this amulet for just a little while longer. You got a problem with that?≺Prompt≻
Hey, and when you're finished with your business here, why don't you come back to Tavnazia? You know the way, right?≺Prompt≻
See ya around!≺Prompt≻
You lend the ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻3≺BAD CHAR: 8280≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻ to Prishe.≺Prompt≻
I'm delighted to see my young patient fully recovered. She's awfully energetic when conscious, isn't she?≺Prompt≻
It appears our visitors have returned to Tavnazia. I admit being most surprised to hear the nation still existed.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, it seems as if you have experienced a trying ordeal in the Northlands.≺Prompt≻
I have attempted to gather information from the Ducal Guard; however, none are willing--or should I say allowed--to speak of the matter, though the fear in their eyes tells much.≺Prompt≻
And that is not all... Recently there have been unsettling rumors that the end of the world is near.≺Prompt≻
Those rumors also say that the young patient that I treated--the girl who had her amulet stolen--is connected with all this in some matter.≺Prompt≻
I have even heard that the Ducal Guard has a warrant out for her arrest...≺Prompt≻
Preposterous! Lady Prishe is simply being used. The true criminal is that boy!≺Prompt≻
Why, if it is not...≺Prompt≻
I apologize for my sudden entrance, Doctor.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻! Something terrible is underway!≺Prompt≻
I have come from the Grand Duke Palace, where I heard of the Duchy's ridiculous plan. Jeuno has begun to mobilize the Ducal Guard in preparation for an attack on...Bahamut!≺Prompt≻
Yes, Bahamut has threatened Vana'diel with the promise of apocalypse. However, he is still one of the terrestrial avatars bound to protect our world.≺Prompt≻
There must be some way to persuade the conqueror of the skies...and that is why I requested to accompany the commander of this operation, Lady Esha'ntarl. Unfortunately...≺Prompt≻

...the commander was not one to listen to reason. She is convinced that it would be futile to try and communicate with Bahamut, and the only way to save the people of Vana'diel is to attack the Wyrmking and his minions before they attack our cities.≺Prompt≻
Excuse me, sir. I am not sure if I fully comprehend what you are trying to say.≺Prompt≻
Bahamut is readying to launch an attack on the four nations? That cannot be true!≺Prompt≻
But if it was...≺Prompt≻
Have the leaders of the nations been informed? Have their armies begun preparations?≺Prompt≻
Unfortunately, San d'Oria, Bastok, and Windurst more than likely remain oblivious to the situation at hand. And even if they did know, they would have no means of mounting a counterattack.≺Prompt≻
Bahamut is known as the conqueror of the skies for a reason. The power he and his minions possess is beyond anything we could imagine--the power to control time and space.≺Prompt≻
Control time and space...?≺Prompt≻
The moment he and his minions were to arrive above our cities would be the moment of our defeat. We would have no choice but to accept annihilation...≺Prompt≻
...≺Prompt≻
But I feel there is still a way...≺Prompt≻
Lady Esha'ntarl mentioned that Bahamut is currently building up the energy necessary for teleporting his fellow wyrms to the locations of attack.≺Prompt≻
If we could reach Bahamut before he has stored enough power, we may be able to persuade him not to begin his ambush of Vana'diel.≺Prompt≻
Persuade him? The end of the world is right before us, and you want to sit down and chat with the bringer of that destruction!?≺Prompt≻
Exactly! With the Phoenix Blade and ≺Player Name≻ by my side, I am positive that I can convince Bahamut to spare the lives of those on this world.≺Prompt≻
But to succeed, I require your assistance, Doctor.≺Prompt≻
I need to know where that boy was first discovered!≺Prompt≻
...!≺Prompt≻
... Understood. Wolfgang, captain of the Ducal Guard, ordered me not to reveal this information to anyone...however, I am afraid I no longer have any choice.≺Prompt≻
On the first floor of Delkfutt's Tower, there is a large doorway that leads into the deeper areas of the spire.≺Prompt≻
It is somewhere down there that the boy mysteriously appeared. A large, central chamber...but that is all I remember.≺Prompt≻
I am extremely grateful for all you have done for us, Doctor. Come, ≺Player Name≻, we have no time to lose.≺Prompt≻
Ah, but there is a door--a locked door, and only Wolfgang knows how to open it.≺Prompt≻
I have no worries, as Phoenix will lead the way.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, make your preparations quickly and meet me at the tower.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, it may be a worthless effort, but let me ask Wolfgang for the key to that chamber.≺Prompt≻
While sometimes misled, he is a man who strongly believes in justice. He may feel that it is solely his duty to protect the world on the eve of its destruction.≺Prompt≻
We must let him know that there are those of us who also follow the same path as he. Here. Take this envelope to the palace guard post. I will be praying for your success, ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻
The boy first appeared in Delkfutt's Tower. On the first floor of the tower, there is a large doorway that leads into the deeper areas of the structure...≺Prompt≻
Wolfgang will know how to open the door that lies beyond. Take this envelope to the palace guard post. I will be praying for your success, ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻
I see by his reaction that Wolfgang understood the meaning of the map.≺Prompt≻
Where should you go? Hah hah. That's a secret, ≺Player Name≻. Though, if you think hard enough, I feel you will come to understand.≺Prompt≻
I knew all along Wolfgang would come. He is a good man, despite being a little stubborn. Now hurry to Delkfutt's Tower. Tenzen should already be on his way.≺Prompt≻
Somewhere on the first floor there is a large doorway that leads to the basement of the tower. The key you received from Wolfgang will open that door.≺Prompt≻
Wolfgang should not be giving you any more problems. I think he has finally started to realize what is truly important in this world.≺Prompt≻
Have you heard the rumors? Some are saying that the end of the world is upon us.≺Prompt≻
Thanks to that, we here at the clinic have lately been spending more time mending people's spirits than their broken bones.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, it is good to see you.≺Prompt≻
We have finally grasped the entire tapestry that our separate tales have woven.≺Prompt≻
I never believed that something like this was possible.≺Prompt≻
I suggest you prepare yourself before Lady Ulmia arrives.≺Prompt≻
Why is everyone so quiet? Is something wrong?≺Prompt≻
Lady Ulmia, we have been waiting for you. Will you steel your heart and listen to the story we have to tell?≺Prompt≻
Of course, we have tried to refute this conclusion and find some other explanation.≺Prompt≻
However, we now know that the boy, Selh'teus, has come to thwart the plans of the ancient ones and steal the light of the crystals.≺Prompt≻
We also know that the Divinity of Darkness that rules over the Kindred was not Promathia after all.≺Prompt≻
But...the Moblins...heard from...the Divinity of Darkness...that the...Keeper of the Apocalypse...has already...arisen.≺Prompt≻
And surely you have seen the magicite imbedded in Prishe's chest?≺Prompt≻
According to your explanation, that stone contained the Emptiness of the Twilight God, Promathia.≺Prompt≻
Lady Ulmia. This must come as a shock for one so close to Lady Prishe.≺Prompt≻
But I must inform you of the facts I have learned from the terrestrial avatars Carbuncle and Fenrir.≺Prompt≻
After ten thousand years, the Keeper of the Apocalypse was fated to be born in the nation of Tavnazia!≺Prompt≻
Surely you are not saying that this keeper you speak of is Prishe!≺Prompt≻
That is impossible! I refuse to believe it!≺Prompt≻
We have been friends since the time before Tavnazia's destruction!≺Prompt≻
I can honestly say that I have never met a person more pure of heart.≺Prompt≻
She has more faith, and more courage...≺Prompt≻
How could she be the Keeper of the Apocalypse and still urge Diabolos to save the world?≺Prompt≻
It is true that I do not know of anyone who possesses the zest for life that Prishe has.≺Prompt≻
And if we had but the time and the knowledge, we would rescue Lady Prishe from this destiny.≺Prompt≻
However, we have no time remaining.≺Prompt≻
A duty lies before us: Lord Bahamut and his minions must be stopped!≺Prompt≻
And if Cardinal Mildaurion is still alive as we believe, she will be planning to use Prishe to awaken the Twilight God.≺Prompt≻
With Prishe and her magicite in the cardinal's possession, the world is one step away from oblivion!≺Prompt≻
When Promathia...awakens...there will be...no stopping...the Moblins.≺Prompt≻
Stop it, all of you. You truly intend to do away with Prishe if it means the plans of Wyrmking Bahamut will be prevented?≺Prompt≻
That is something I cannot do!≺Prompt≻
Lady Ulmia!≺Prompt≻
...≺Prompt≻
Let her be. The first thing we have to do is rrrescue Prishe from the Grand Duke Palace. I'll start working on a plan.≺Prompt≻
I will call upon some old acquaintances. They may be able to help us.≺Prompt≻
I wish...no more lives...to be lost. I...will do...what I can.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻
Do you agree with our decision?≺Prompt≻
Do you agree? ≺Selection Dialog≻No, I don't. There's no other way. What decision?≺Prompt≻
Do not let our actions concern you.≺Prompt≻
You are free to follow your own path from here.≺Prompt≻
I only ask that you look after Lady Ulmia. She did not take this news well.≺Prompt≻
There is little you can say to comfort her, but at least see her safely to Tavnazia.≺Prompt≻
If you ask the aid of Lady Esha'ntarl, I am sure your return will be a swift one.≺Prompt≻
Until we meet again!≺Prompt≻
You understand what we have all agreed to here? We have come to a brutal and bloody conclusion.≺Prompt≻
Although no one life holds more importance than another, I have a duty to save the world, no matter the cost.≺Prompt≻
But still... I worry for Lady Ulmia.≺Prompt≻
In order to save the world from destruction, we must defeat the one known as the Keeper of the Apocalypse.≺Prompt≻
Even if Lady Prishe herself is the Keeper, I will not fail to carry out this task.≺Prompt≻
A beautiful lady justaru ran that way, tears streaming down her face. I've never seen anything like it.≺Prompt≻
Today is Tarutaru day at the pub, and she was an Elvaan. I can understand how that'd make you want to cry.≺Prompt≻
I am glad to see that you have all survived unscathed.≺Prompt≻
You...!≺Prompt≻
You are...the priest...!?≺Prompt≻
Nice to see you both again after so long.≺Prompt≻
It's been twenty years since I've seen you, Shikaree Z. And a hundred years for you, Jabbos, if I'm not mistaken.≺Prompt≻
And you, the man of extraordinary luck.≺Prompt≻
I am most delighted to be in your presence once more, Cardinal Mildaurion.≺Prompt≻
I would love to celebrate this long overdue reunion; however, now is not the time.≺Prompt≻
Lord Bahamut has revealed to us an unsettling truth--the Keeper of the Apocalypse waits in the celestial capital of Al'Taieu.≺Prompt≻
Until now, the Armathrwn Society had believed the city of Al'Taieu destroyed.≺Prompt≻
Judging by the counsel of the terrestrial avatars and the memories of Selh'teus, however, we can assume that the celestial capital still exists.≺Prompt≻
The society is now focused on gaining further information. To this end, the objective of our next operation is to capture--not kill--Lord Bahamut.≺Prompt≻
I, Esha'ntarl, will join the main fleet of warships and head once more to the ends of the earth.≺Prompt≻
But there is another important matter that requires our immediate attention--a matter involving the fifth mothercrystal.≺Prompt≻
Someone has apparently severed the fifth crystal from the Crystal Line.≺Prompt≻
When the boy, Selh'teus, appeared, was not this Crystal Line the conduit he traversed with Lord Bahamut?≺Prompt≻
Just a damn moment! So now we can't use this pipeline gizmo to get to the fifth mothercrystal!?≺Prompt≻
How are we supposed to get to Al'Taieu and wipe the floor with the Keeper of the Apocalypse!?≺Prompt≻
How, indeed. In any event, we must search for an alternative route now that Phoenix is no longer with us.≺Prompt≻
Wait. Mildaurion, you mentioned that “someone” isolated the fifth mothercrystal?≺Prompt≻
Who is rrresponsible for this act of sabotage?≺Prompt≻
I do not know. The only people capable of such a feat would be either Selh'teus, or Nag'molada...≺Prompt≻
I currently have Jeunoan troops preparing to invade Movalpolos.≺Prompt≻
M...Movalpolos...!?≺Prompt≻
The Moblins...are in danger...!? I must...leave...immediately!≺Prompt≻
Jabbos has spent a century living with the Moblins in an effort to avert this sort of development.≺Prompt≻
This is most worrisome. I shall follow him and see he does not come to harm.≺Prompt≻
I will accompany you!≺Prompt≻
I realize that Jabbos has tried for years to convince the Moblins that they are not the children of Promathia.≺Prompt≻
But for the sake of the mothercrystal, the Moblins cannot be left to their own devices.≺Prompt≻
If he fails to persuade them otherwise, they may attempt to destroy the fifth crystal.≺Prompt≻
Destroy the crystal!?≺Prompt≻
The mothercrystal is at both the beginning and the end of a person's journey in this life.≺Prompt≻
After learning this fact from Jabbos, the Moblins now believe that destroying the mothercrystal will spell the end for the children of Altana.≺Prompt≻
How could Jabbos fail to mention something so important!?≺Prompt≻
He had no choice. If that kinda thing became public knowledge, Movalpolos would be gutted and all the Moblins slaughtered.≺Prompt≻
!≺Prompt≻
Miss Mildaurion. I'm not in a position to be giving advice to a ten thousand-year-old, but just hear me out.≺Prompt≻
Killing every last Moblin might make this mess all nice and neat, but it's not what I'd call a solution.≺Prompt≻
Isn't this the exact same thing that Bahamut is trying to do?≺Prompt≻
...≺Prompt≻
You are right... Nothing good can come of this...≺Prompt≻
I will plead with the Armathrwn Society to find a peaceable solution to this problem.≺Prompt≻
Thanks, Miss Mildaurion!≺Prompt≻
But from this point onward I will be joining the society to monitor its actions.≺Prompt≻
My movements will be limited, but rest assured that I will be watching over you always. Now go, my brave companions. The fate of the world and her people is in your hands.≺Prompt≻
Alrighty! Ulmia, Tenzen, ≺Player Name≻! On to Movalpolos!≺Prompt≻
Everyone who wants to scrap it out for the ultimate victory, follow me!!!≺Prompt≻
I hear this pub is sometimes reserved by the head of the Tenshodo.≺Prompt≻
Not a momentaru ago, there were Mithra and Galka and all sorts filing out the door. They were saying something about going to Movalpolos.≺Prompt≻
Are they thinking of bringing their beastmen buddies back here? Next thing you know, they'll be having “Goblin's Day.”≺Prompt≻
You must indeed be serious about your beliefs to choose the Temple of the Goddess over the bustling sights and sounds of Jeuno.≺Prompt≻
In my long years I have come to discover that a person serious about ≺Multiple Choice (Player Gender)≻[his/her] beliefs is a person who can be trusted with a serious task.≺Prompt≻
Are you willing to hear my request?≺Prompt≻
Listen to his request? ≺Selection Dialog≻I'll listen. I come here for the peace and quiet.≺Prompt≻
Thank you, adventurer. Perhaps you have heard of the ruins of Pso'Xja, that are found on the Beaucedine Glacier?≺Prompt≻
It is whispered that those ruins are deeply entwined with the history of the ancients.≺Prompt≻
When thieves discovered the mysterious structures in later years, they were quick to put up iron grates at the tower entrances and carry away the relics within.≺Prompt≻
However, they were never able to open the decorated gate that lies in the deepest part of the ruins. The thieves searched for a way to open this portal for many years.≺Prompt≻
Only recently did they finally stumble across the key to the gate. What they found inside apparently did not live up to their expectations.≺Prompt≻
Believing that they had claimed all the treasures to be found, the Tenshodo opened almost every area of the six towers to adventurers.≺Prompt≻
I do not agree with the Tenshodo's appraisal of their final discovery. The magical device that was hidden behind that gate closely resembles those that exist in the towers of Sarutabaruta.≺Prompt≻
Would this not mean that the towers of Pso'Xja have a similar function to the Sarutabaruta ruins?≺Prompt≻
I have had adventurers who share your level of integrity delve into the ruins several times to investigate this possibility.≺Prompt≻
I do not think the Tenshodo has given the matter due consideration. A magical device was found on the other side of that gate.≺Prompt≻
No one knows the purpose behind the towers' construction, and it is far too dangerous to allow the general population access to the ruins without further research.≺Prompt≻
And that is why I decided to ask adventurers who share your level of integrity to place a seal upon that gate.≺Prompt≻
The only problem is, not one adventurer has been able to reach it. There are two other gates that block the path to the deepest section of the southwest tower.≺Prompt≻
Will you attempt to find a way into the southwest tower's heart?≺Prompt≻
Will you go? ≺Selection Dialog≻I will. I don't think so.≺Prompt≻

You will be able to open the final gate with this ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻3ａ≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻. It should also activate the magical device that lies beyond.≺Prompt≻
Once the device is activated, return here for your reward. I pray for your success.≺Prompt≻
Seal the final gate using this ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻3ｂ≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻. I pray for your success.≺Prompt≻

That was too close... Thankfully, the device was activated before those meddling scholars from Windurst arrived.≺Prompt≻
But my work is not done. I must find a way to seal the device so that no one can stop it...≺Prompt≻
You have my thanks. It appears the obstructions within the tower did not prevent you from activating the device.≺Prompt≻
The devices within the other towers are also being activated, one by one. Please accept your reward.≺Prompt≻
You have my thanks. It appears the obstructions within the tower did not prevent you from sealing the gate.≺Prompt≻
Do not be concerned; the gates within the other towers are being sealed as we speak. Please accept your reward.≺Prompt≻
Ah, the gate did not open for you? That is because a more experienced adventurer activated the device before you arrived.≺Prompt≻
However, I still wish to recognize your sincere desire to carry out my request. Please accept this token of my appreciation.≺Prompt≻
What would happen should all of the devices be activated? I really couldn't say.≺Prompt≻
However, I am assured that... Ah...never mind.≺Prompt≻
However, how am I to seal...? Ah...never mind.≺Prompt≻

I apologize, but your level is too low to participate in an official Brenner match.≺Prompt≻
Official matches are scheduled to begin at the following times: Match 1: ≺Unknown Parameter (Type: AB) 0≻ Match 2: ≺Unknown Parameter (Type: AB) 1≻ Match 3: ≺Unknown Parameter (Type: AB) 2≻≺Prompt≻
Teleportation to the Isle is free of charge, but a participation fee of ≺Numeric Parameter 0≻ gil is required before each match.≺Prompt≻
Travel to the Isle? ≺Selection Dialog≻Yes. Not yet.≺Prompt≻
What would you like to know about? ≺Selection Dialog≻Basic rules. Official/private matches. Flammen-Brenner. Flamme. Match score. Petras and quarrying. Sprint. KO. Return.≺Prompt≻
The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:≺Prompt≻
First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of “Flammen-Brenner.”≺Prompt≻
At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with “Flamme,” or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.≺Prompt≻
Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.≺Prompt≻
The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.≺Prompt≻
The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.≺Prompt≻
If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The “match score” section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.≺Prompt≻
Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.≺Prompt≻
You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.≺Prompt≻
No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.≺Prompt≻

The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed ≺Numeric Parameter 0≻ members, or if there are fewer than ≺Numeric Parameter 1≻ members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.≺Prompt≻
Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The ≺Set Color #5≻Master of Ceremonies≺Set Color #1≻ (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.≺Prompt≻
“LS Liga” is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.≺Prompt≻
A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.≺Prompt≻
The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.≺Prompt≻
If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.≺Prompt≻
After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.≺Prompt≻
Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.≺Prompt≻
In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.≺Prompt≻

Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.≺Prompt≻

Like Ballista, ≺Set Color #5≻quarry≺Set Color #1≻ (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up ≺Set Color #5≻Petras≺Set Color #1≻ and temporary items.≺Prompt≻

However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can ≺Set Color #5≻trade≺Set Color #1≻ a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.≺Prompt≻
≺Set Color #5≻Sprint≺Set Color #1≻ cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the ≺Set Color #5≻scout≺Set Color #1≻ ability cannot be used in Brenner.≺Prompt≻
Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.≺Prompt≻
The ≺Set Color #5≻sprint≺Set Color #1≻ (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.≺Prompt≻
In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.≺Prompt≻
In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.≺Prompt≻
I'm sorry. I wasn't listening. Could you start over from the beginning?≺Prompt≻
I was thinking this out loud when an Elvaan girl passing by stopped to talk to me.≺Prompt≻
But what about moogles? They've got wings, and they can fly, but you wouldn't call 'em birds. They've got those funny antennae, too, but they're not insects, either.≺Prompt≻
When I responded to her remark with the fact that both moogles and chocobos are animals, this is what she asked:≺Prompt≻
Then what's the difference between animals and people?≺Prompt≻
I answered, “People are smarter than animals.” And then she retorted, “People sure are more sly!”≺Prompt≻
Ahahaha, don't get all huffy on me! I stopped to talk because what you were saying was important.≺Prompt≻
People are all different from one another. They're different from animals, and different from plants. This difference is what makes it all worth it.≺Prompt≻
There are lots of ways to think and feel, and things to know and to believe. But in the end, we all come from the same source.≺Prompt≻
That's true for both people and animals.≺Prompt≻
We all have this thing called a soul. The souls of animals are pure and simple.≺Prompt≻
Look over there. That chocobo is living proof.≺Prompt≻
You should ask someone how that chocobo was born. Then you'll have your answers.≺Prompt≻
...And then she went on her way.≺Prompt≻
I went to find out how that chocobo was born, but no one could tell me.≺Prompt≻
Shalott said the chocobo's mother was from the stables in Bastok.≺Prompt≻
She said it was a special chocobo that had silver-colored feathers on its neck.≺Prompt≻
How I wish I could go to Bastok to see her for myself.≺Prompt≻
I wonder if that Elvaan girl will be passing by again anytime soon...≺Prompt≻
That Elvaan girl told me that both people and animals have souls. She said that the souls of animals are far more pure than those of people.≺Prompt≻
She also told me I would understand what she meant if I found out how that chocobo was born.≺Prompt≻
According to Shalott, the chocobo's mother is from the stables in Bastok. How I wish I could go there to see her for myself...≺Prompt≻
What can I do for you? If you want to ride a chocobo, one of the girls over there can help you out.≺Prompt≻
Lately, a lot of adventurers seem to be forgetting that a chocobo is an animal, not an object.≺Prompt≻
You should keep that in mind as you're enjoying that easy ride through monster-ridden badlands. Have a safe journey.≺Prompt≻
A chocobo with silver-colored feathers...?≺Prompt≻
Ah, you'd be talking about Silver Comet.≺Prompt≻
She used to be the mount of a highly ranked general in the Bastokan navy.≺Prompt≻
The general's son received the chocobo as a coming-of-age present, which he promptly took advantage of to leave Bastok.≺Prompt≻
For the longest time, no one saw hide nor hair of man or beast--until eventually, Silver Comet came wandering back into town...alone.≺Prompt≻
I heard later on that the general's son had lost his life somewhere in the wilds.≺Prompt≻
Only Silver Comet had managed to return unharmed.≺Prompt≻
In memory of his son, the general asked us to take the chocobo into our care...≺Prompt≻
But then one day, Silver Comet was gone. Some chocobo thief had stolen her.≺Prompt≻
Hm? You say a chick of Silver Comet's is being kept in the Jeuno stables? You must be mistaken.≺Prompt≻
Anyway, after the theft, the general exhausted every avenue in search of his son's chocobo.≺Prompt≻
He eventually found an adventurer who allegedly saw a chocobo drowning in the Pashhow Marshlands.≺Prompt≻
That chocobo had the same markings as Silver Comet.≺Prompt≻
If you want to try talking to that adventurer, you should go to the outpost in the marshlands.≺Prompt≻
He's given up the adventuring life, it seems. Now he earns his daily bread by seeing to the needs of the soldiers at the outpost.≺Prompt≻
The gate is locked.≺Prompt≻
Whaddaya want? I got no time for adventurers.≺Prompt≻
Huh? Where'd you hear... Well, whatever.≺Prompt≻
You say you got business with me?≺Prompt≻
Silver Comet... What the hell are you bothering me about that old chocobo story for? You some kind of crackpot?≺Prompt≻
Leave me alone, you loon.≺Prompt≻
Can't you see I'm busy? This place gets too wet and too dark too quick to be wasting time chatting.≺Prompt≻
Hold up a minute. If you bring me some ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻%ａ≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻, I might be willing to give you the time of day.≺Prompt≻
Yep, three of those ought to do it. I'll give you until the day after tomorrow.≺Prompt≻
You brought what I asked for? Careful with that stuff, it's powerful smelly.≺Prompt≻
It's good for hiding a person's scent, you see. Helps me get around.≺Prompt≻
Now, then. You wanted to hear about that chocobo, right?≺Prompt≻
She was one of the fastest chocobos I've ever ridden, but damn near uncontrollable. I don't know how Silver Comet's owner handled her.≺Prompt≻
I guess the death of her former owner is what sent her off the edge. That chocobo wasn't right in the head.≺Prompt≻
She threw herself headlong into the marshes. Thought my number was up, I can tell you!≺Possible Special Code: 00≻
When I saw her in the stables, she was wearing a collar attached to a chain.≺Prompt≻
That wasn't to keep the general's mount from being stolen--it was to keep Silver Comet from flying the coop, so to speak.≺Prompt≻
That general's a real schemer. Said that if Silver Comet was released, she would be able to find Shooting Star.≺Prompt≻
It's his fault I almost got killed!≺Prompt≻
Huh? Who's Shooting Star? He's a chocobo, too.≺Prompt≻
Shooting Star was Silver Comet's mate.≺Prompt≻
Their love was a pure, uncomplicated thing, much more so than what people feel.≺Prompt≻
Ahahaha! I think this oil is starting to muddle my senses. I'll see you around, adventurer.≺Prompt≻
Were you able to meet with that adventurer?≺Prompt≻
...Is that right? I think you were around that ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻#ａ≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻ a bit too long.≺Prompt≻
It sounds to me like that adventurer was the one who stole Silver Comet in the first place.≺Prompt≻
Or at least you would think so, if the thief wasn't supposed to have drowned in the marsh as well.≺Prompt≻
You mentioned a “Shooting Star”? I know that name.≺Prompt≻
That chocobo was raised alongside Silver Comet. Those two were almost inseparable as chicks.≺Prompt≻
Unfortunately, unlike Silver Comet's case, Shooting Star died saving his master.≺Prompt≻
I'm guessing Silver Comet was trying to find him when she jumped into that marsh. The general mentioned something similar at the time, I recall.≺Prompt≻
Hm? Still trying to convince me that her chick is in Jeuno?≺Prompt≻
I'm sorry, but I really think you're mistaken. I mean, the general even had Silver Comet's collar.≺Prompt≻
He said he was going to lay it on his son's grave in Batallia Downs.≺Prompt≻
But, wait. I seem to remember that collar being sent by a man named Brutus. He runs a chocobo stable in Jeuno...≺Prompt≻
Why would the collar be sent from Jeuno when Silver Comet drowned in the Pashhow Marshlands?≺Prompt≻
You are being attacked!≺Prompt≻
Now is not the time for that!≺Prompt≻
You sense something is not quite right...≺Prompt≻
You find nothing.≺Prompt≻
I...I don't know what you're talking about.≺Prompt≻
Wow... So this collar belonged to that chocobo's mother, Silver Comet?≺Prompt≻
I would place this on the grave of her mate, Shooting Star, if I only knew where it was.≺Prompt≻
So you're the two snoopers who were asking Shalott about Silver Comet.≺Prompt≻
That collar...!?≺Prompt≻
You've dug pretty far into this old story. Looks like after twenty years, people start to let things slip.≺Prompt≻
Please don't be angry, Brutus.≺Prompt≻
I found out that chocobos can fall in love, just like people do.≺Prompt≻
There was a girl who taught me that animals and people are the same.≺Prompt≻
I think the story of Silver Comet and Shooting Star helped me to really understand what she meant.≺Prompt≻
Well then, I suppose I'll have to tell you the whole tale.≺Prompt≻
Silver Comet and Shooting Star never really died.≺Prompt≻
Really!?≺Prompt≻
Shooting Star was a special chocobo that was attacked by an evil man.≺Prompt≻
He was badly wounded when they brought him here, and we all worked hard to get him back on his feet.≺Prompt≻
But Shooting Star was still being chased by the evil man, so we had to hide him away.≺Prompt≻
We took him to a place in the west of Batallia Downs, where that villain would never find him.≺Prompt≻
But the bad man was clever. He knew that if he had Silver Comet, her bond to Shooting Star would lead them right to the chocobo's hiding place.≺Prompt≻
Silver Comet was one smart chocobo, though.≺Prompt≻
She deliberately dove into the marshes to force the villain from her back.≺Prompt≻
It was an extremely dangerous thing for Silver Comet to do.≺Prompt≻
But she never gave up. She had to protect her mate from the man who meant to hurt him.≺Prompt≻
Silver Comet swam through the muck and dragged herself free of the marshlands. She was finally able to make it to Shooting Star's side.≺Prompt≻
That's when I took off her collar and set her free.≺Prompt≻
What happened to them after that?≺Prompt≻
Did they live happily ever after?≺Prompt≻
That's right. And the youngest of the brood they raised together is that chocobo right over there.≺Prompt≻
What a great story...≺Prompt≻
It's not over yet. The villain of this tale is still lurking around somewhere.≺Prompt≻
That's why you can never tell anybody what you've heard here today. You want to keep that chocobo safe, right?≺Prompt≻
Right!≺Prompt≻
I'll never tell, I promise!≺Prompt≻
Glad to hear it. And one more thing...≺Prompt≻
Don't forget how Silver Comet never gave up on her mate.≺Prompt≻
Even when those they love and believe in have gone, animals will keep on striving.≺Prompt≻
Right. That's because animals come from the same source as people.≺Prompt≻
Adventurer, you can have this. Keep this story to yourself.≺Prompt≻
Thank you so much! And this is from me.≺Prompt≻
I wonder if that Elvaan girl knows how Silver Comet and Shooting Star were married.≺Prompt≻
I would like to meet her again some day...≺Prompt≻
Press any button to continue.≺Prompt≻
At the request of a certain society, I am investigating the effects of the dreaded “Emptiness” on living beings.≺Prompt≻
You appear to be a well-traveled adventurer. Perhaps you have seen one of the Emptiness-ravaged creatures of which I speak?≺Prompt≻
We have labeled these monstrosities “Empty Notorious Monsters,” or ENMs...≺Prompt≻
Have you seen one? ≺Selection Dialog≻Indeed I have. I'm not quite sure...≺Prompt≻
Aha, so you have firsthand experience. You probably don't need a scholar's explanation, but please indulge me...≺Prompt≻

The material presence of ENMs has become temporary and insubstantial, meaning that those who have witnessed a particular ENM's existence are unable to encounter it again until a period of time has passed.≺Prompt≻
My research has allowed me to measure the length of time between ENM manifestations. Tell me, which ENM would you like to know about?≺Prompt≻

I wish to know about the ENM in... ≺Selection Dialog≻Nowhere in particular. The Spire of Holla. The Spire of Dem. The Spire of Mea. The Spire of Vahzl. Monarch Linn. The Shrouded Maw. Mine Shaft #2716. Bearclaw Pinnacle. Boneyard Gully.≺Prompt≻
You won't be able to encounter that particular ENM until ≺Unknown Parameter (Type: AC) 1≻ (≺Unknown Parameter (Type: AB) 1≻ Earth time).≺Prompt≻

You have no need of my expertise at the moment? Very well.≺Prompt≻

If there is an ENM that you are currently able to locate, I strongly urge you to take action.≺Prompt≻
These...creatures...are no longer natural beings of Vana'diel. They must be destroyed.≺Prompt≻
I cannot elaborate on the details, but know that the fate of the world depends on the early elimination of this threat...≺Prompt≻
Then perhaps it is best if you forget this conversation entirely.≺Prompt≻

≺Player Name≻! Lady Esha'ntarl's ship has returned.≺Prompt≻
This is excellent timing. I was ordered to find you and ask that you proceed to the Marble Bridge--the tavern in Upper Jeuno.≺Prompt≻
My duty here is done. I must now journey to each nation and report that the Wyrmking Bahamut no longer poses a threat.≺Prompt≻
I hear that this development is all thanks to you and your companions. You have the gratitude of all Jeunoans.≺Prompt≻
I have awaited your return, ≺Player Name≻. You must tell me all that has happened.≺Prompt≻
After clashing with our army several times, the dragons suddenly broke off their attack and disappeared into the distant clouds.≺Prompt≻
There were voices raised in support of hunting the wyrms into extinction, but for the moment we have returned to resupply and reconsider our position.≺Prompt≻
Now that you are here, I can finally be certain.≺Prompt≻
Am I to assume from your jubilant features that the Keeper of the Apocalypse has been defeated?≺Prompt≻

I knew it! Bahamut sensed the keeper's downfall and pulled his forces out of battle...≺Prompt≻
Tell me. What momentous events transpired in the Celestial Capital?≺Prompt≻
On Cape Riverne, the images that flowed into me from Selh'teus...≺Prompt≻
They were of the incomplete Paradise, Al'Taieu...≺Prompt≻
The people of Al'Taieu returned to their deity ten thousand years ago. Returned to Promathia...≺Prompt≻
“Opening the Gates of Paradise” is a metaphor for restoring the shattered mothercrystal. A way to return the world to its original state.≺Prompt≻
The world becomes a paradise, and its people ascend to godhood. The Dawnmaiden Yve'noile has memories of witnessing the true form of the great goddess Altana.≺Prompt≻
Yve'noile spoke to me before we parted ways.≺Prompt≻
She said, “As I gazed upon her perfection, I realized I could not be a part of her. I wondered who I could possibly be.”≺Prompt≻
That was when she began her research into the race of people.≺Prompt≻
After shifting her focus to the inexplicable appearance of the Kuluu phenomenon, Yve'noile became aware of the darkness that resided within us all.≺Prompt≻
Her realization led her to betray the king and his son, and adamantly oppose any plan to open the Gates of Paradise.≺Prompt≻
She had discovered our origins as the children of Promathia...≺Prompt≻
But all has not been resolved.≺Prompt≻
The Emptiness still seethes within the mothercrystals.≺Prompt≻
And the surviving Zilart yet cling desperately to their shadowy plan of returning to Paradise.≺Prompt≻
I gave up my life in Tavnazia almost thirty years ago to infiltrate the organization of the newly awakened Zilart.≺Prompt≻
But I have been unable to stem their vast power on my own.≺Prompt≻
However, we now have a common enemy in the Emptiness. For a time, the people of this age will require the aid of the ancients.≺Prompt≻
The ancients, too, will need your continuing help.≺Prompt≻
Surely the Dawn Maiden has bequeathed something of value to her younger kin.≺Prompt≻
I will find out what this may be, and speak with Archduke Kam'lanaut. He will heed my words.≺Prompt≻
I shall continue to watch over the world that you and your companions have fought so valiantly to protect.≺Prompt≻
Now that Nag'molada is gone and the wyrms have ceased their attacks, it is time to remind the Zilart of their true responsibility:≺Prompt≻
The safety of the mothercrystals and the battle against the Emptiness.≺Prompt≻
I will continue to monitor their actions as I watch over the world that you and your companions have fought so valiantly to protect.≺Prompt≻
There is one thing I'd like you to keep in mind, ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻
You were able to save the world and her people without sacrificing one or the other.≺Prompt≻
But do not misunderstand.≺Prompt≻
This possibility did not always exist.≺Prompt≻

I apologize, but it seems that you cannot visit the Isle yet. I have nothing to say to you.≺Prompt≻
There is something I must tell the adventurers of Jeuno! If you could just give me a bit of your time...≺Prompt≻
Listen to what he has to say? ≺Selection Dialog≻Sure. Not now.≺Prompt≻
Well then, you must come back when you have more time!≺Prompt≻
I believe this is our first meeting.≺Prompt≻
I am Afdeen, pupil of the great Abdhaljs before even Tillecoe. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.≺Prompt≻
There is a reason why I am here. Allow me to explain...≺Prompt≻
An interesting idea was proposed at the last Conquest Evaluation Assembly...≺Prompt≻
...And so it seems that the adventurers are using their own unique set of rules for Ballista.≺Prompt≻
There is also the remarkable news that the most capable adventurers in the world came together for a tournament that encompassed the greater part of Vana'diel.≺Prompt≻
Ballista has been taken out of our hands and placed into those of the adventurers.≺Prompt≻
I agree. The Ballista participants have forced us to recall the true meaning of the word “hero.”≺Prompt≻
The revival of Ballista has raised morale and restored public order. I suppose we have achieved our original goals.≺Prompt≻
...We have, have we?≺Prompt≻
It certainly sounds like someone's a mite bitter...≺Prompt≻
Volker can't just mumble and grumble at Destin's baby boy. If you want an explanation, then stop being coy!≺Prompt≻
You have to charge in! Be frank and direct. That's the only way to get the response you expect!≺Prompt≻
What did you just call me!?≺Prompt≻
Stop quarreling! It is my fault for mumbling to myself. Please listen to what I have to say.≺Prompt≻
I agree that the San d'Orian Royal Knights are endowed with sound, quick decision-making abilities and deserve admiration.≺Prompt≻
The deeds of a single hero are capable of setting afire the hearts of many a soldier. We must not neglect the power of motivation in leading an army to victory.≺Prompt≻
Even so, soldiers must be able to follow their commander's orders and fulfill their given roles. Arbitrary decisions can lead an entire army to its doom.≺Prompt≻
Thus, I am of the opinion that observing Ballista matches in their current state may not be a beneficial practice for our armies.≺Prompt≻
Your remarks are inexcusable! How dare you denounce a San d'Orian tradition! I suggest you reconsider your statements.≺Prompt≻
I apologize. I must admit that Ballista has noticeably improved the skills of many an adventurer and educated our soldiers on the importance of courage.≺Prompt≻

However, the reality is that our armies are divided into several units, each with its own role. The soldiers must be able to coordinate themselves effectively and behave as a whole. I believe that a new form of Conflict that trains participants to work in a group would be most rewarding.≺Prompt≻
Harumph, do we look like children to you? You could have cut that explanation in half and it would have been more than sufficientaru!≺Prompt≻
All right then. I'll get straight to the point now.≺Prompt≻
Oh, give us a break! What point could you make? All your vague statements and whatnot! Why not lend an ear to what I've got?≺Prompt≻
No thanks... Well then, I shall be frank.≺Prompt≻
I propose the reinstatement of “Brenner” as a new form of Conflict!≺Prompt≻
Brenner!?≺Prompt≻

I remember that name. Before the Great War, Brenner was used in the selection of the Gold Musketeers. However, the competition was extraordinarily fierce, and it is said that the casualties always exceeded the number of successful candidates.≺Prompt≻
Those stories were fabricated simply to exaggerate the danger of Brenner.≺Prompt≻
Brenner was originally created as a training exercise for mineworkers. The outcome of each match relied on the participants' skill in role management and encouraged team competition.≺Prompt≻

Of course, I am not suggesting that we abolish Ballista. I simply advise that we add Brenner to the list of training options in order to supply the elements of teamwork that I find lacking in current matches.≺Prompt≻
Hmph, so you wish to fortify your army by tying them tightly together in iron bonds. How very-wery Bastokan!≺Prompt≻
Ohohoho! Still, the idea makes my heart race! I even support it. You make a good case!≺Prompt≻
Ohohoho! So if your weaklings unite, you think you can win any fight?≺Prompt≻
Oho, this is rich! May your plan go without hitch!≺Prompt≻
I will support your plan, but please be aware that against the black mages, no one's got a prayer!≺Prompt≻
If it will supplement Ballista, I believe that even Excenmille would have no argument. You have my approval.≺Prompt≻
I appreciate your decision. Now I also would like to suggest that we do away with the license requirement and nationality restrictions for Brenner.≺Prompt≻
Quite a bold statement. However, teams would be composed of complete strangers if we enforce what you propose. Is that your desire?≺Prompt≻
The adventurers have taught me much, but one of the greatest lessons I have learned is the strength of the bond between linkshell members.≺Prompt≻

Linkshells provide an exemplary model of unity. The cooperation and friendly competition of these groups are like those of the closest companions or even family. And thus, I propose that we introduce matches divided by linkshell rather than nation.≺Prompt≻
Interesting. You seem to have worked out these plans more thoroughly than I expected. Have you also given consideration to where the matches will be held?≺Prompt≻
Of course. Wolfgang, shall we invite our guest in now?≺Prompt≻
A pleasure to make your acquaintance. I am called Afdeen.≺Prompt≻
I have come to your lands by order of the great Abdhaljs.≺Prompt≻
By Altana! Do you mean to suggest that you are a direct disciple of Sir Abdhaljs? I believe I have heard your name before.≺Prompt≻
Is your master in good health? He deserves our gratitude for the Diorama...≺Prompt≻
Yes, he is quite well. However, he desires no reward. He is quite pleased with the Ballista matches that take place each day in the Diorama.≺Prompt≻
On another note, he has expressed interest in a new form of Conflict. He has entrusted me with matters regarding his new diorama, which is designed after Purgonorgo Isle.≺Prompt≻
The great Abdhaljs has created a new diorama specifically for this new form of Conflict? Magnificent! You will hear no argument from me.≺Prompt≻
That's dandy-wandy, but don't forget that Windurst won't lend a single gil to the project!≺Prompt≻
Well, there you have it. The preparations sound fine! Okay then, inform me when Windurst is next in line!≺Prompt≻
The reinstatement of Brenner has now been approved!≺Prompt≻
I will send a detailed explanation of the rules to each of you. If you should have any objections, please take them up with Sir Wolfgang.≺Prompt≻
Obviously, the citizens of Windurst have the closestaru bond. Our adventurers will have to teach the rest of you a thing or two about teamwork now.≺Prompt≻
I am simply beside myself--my prayers will not cease! Wishing your people get through this in one piece! Ohohoho～!≺Prompt≻
I will not stand for these meaningless insults against the Royal Knights! Our records in Ballista prove our prowess in working as a team.≺Prompt≻
I think it is time to call this meeting to a close. Thank you all for your participation.≺Prompt≻
How can any idea be interesting when Bastok thoughtaru of it first?≺Prompt≻
You're missing the point--this'll make them prepared for the time that they're needed, my plans unimpaired!≺Prompt≻
Your plans? You can't mean...≺Prompt≻
Now to just wait and see what Brenner will bring to me!≺Prompt≻
I'll need many a strong adventurer for my grand plans, that's for sure! Ohohoho!≺Prompt≻
Sending Ajido-Marujido to the assembly had results most intriguing. They actually helped me save time for my scheming!≺Prompt≻
And time waits for no man! But lucky me--I'm a woman! Ohohohoho!≺Prompt≻
...And that, roughly, is how Brenner was reinstated.≺Prompt≻

I'm a little surprised that there are so many adventurers in our nation who are set on becoming mercenaries.≺Prompt≻
Have they forgotten the pain and fear they went through in the last war?≺Prompt≻

≺Possible Special Code: 1F≻≺Possible Special Code: 0F≻Luto Mewrilah's badge flashes brightly.≺Prompt≻

Rumors of the archduke's approval of the mercenary recruiters have increased people's trust. Perhaps that's why there are so many applications for the Salaheem's Sentinels--despite its location far across the Gugru Blue.≺Prompt≻
Maybe if I become famous there as a Jeunoan, the archduke would invite me to meet him and honor me as the pride of his people!≺Prompt≻
The people of Aht Urhgan do not worship Altana. Instead, they offer their prayers to a heathen deity. Such a vile practice.≺Prompt≻
Still, the light of the Goddess shines upon all without favor. I am sure that someday they will also come to know Altana's compassion.≺Prompt≻
Hey, what're you starin' at? Haven't ya ever seen a chocobo before?≺Prompt≻
Chocobos may be tame creatures now, but they originally came from the wild.≺Prompt≻
La Theine was once covered in wild chocobos. Flocks of 'em used to dart about the plains.≺Prompt≻
That's why they love it when you take 'em back there. It runs through their blood.≺Prompt≻
Kweh!≺Prompt≻
Looks like it's feedin' time.≺Prompt≻
It looks like the chocobo wants to venture outside town...≺Prompt≻
Sneak the chocobo outside? ≺Selection Dialog≻Free the chocobo! No. Think of Brutus!≺Prompt≻
Kweh...≺Prompt≻
Whew, these chocobos always act like they're starving...≺Prompt≻
...What's this?≺Prompt≻
One of the chocobos is gone! I never thought I'd see the day!≺Prompt≻
Could he have understood what we were talking about earlier?≺Prompt≻
That chocobo always was a smart one. I wouldn't be surprised if he did understand, and went off in search of his wild companions...≺Prompt≻
But wild chocobos don't exist anymore.≺Prompt≻
That chocobo was raised in a stable. He doesn't realize how harsh the world out there is! What if he were attacked by some despicable creature?≺Prompt≻
Please help me bring him back!≺Prompt≻
The chocobo that escaped probably headed for La Theine... Good luck finding him.≺Prompt≻
Thanks for bringing the chocobo back.≺Prompt≻
He's been acting a bit strange ever since returning, though.≺Prompt≻
He used to be so responsive to commands, but lately he's become rather stubborn. It's not a good influence on the other chocobos.≺Prompt≻
I wonder what happened at La Theine...≺Prompt≻
So it is happening even here...≺Prompt≻
Hm? You're from San d'Oria, aren't you? So the chocobos are acting strangely there too?≺Prompt≻
That is correct, sir. Something appears to be stirring among the chocobos... We must call the Vana'diel Chocobo Society into session immediately.≺Prompt≻
I shall rally the members from the nations of Vana'diel myself. As soon as you have made your preparations, please make haste to the chocobo stables in San d'Oria.≺Prompt≻
What a mess...≺Prompt≻
Sorry, but I think you should also attend the session. You're the one who last saw the chocobo before the change...≺Prompt≻
Kweh!!!≺Prompt≻
What a travesty...≺Prompt≻
Is this how chocobos would behave without our intervention?≺Prompt≻
I apologize for the delay.≺Prompt≻
Kweh!≺Prompt≻
Kweh!≺Prompt≻
Kweh!!!≺Prompt≻
Kweh!!!≺Prompt≻

≺Player Name≻, what is the meaning of this?≺Prompt≻

They had us all worked up over nothing...≺Prompt≻
Kweh...≺Prompt≻
Kweeeh...≺Prompt≻
Kweh!≺Prompt≻

Looks like they're already doing better. Chocobos are really somethin', aren't they?≺Prompt≻
They're much cuter like this.≺Prompt≻
Thanks to you, the chocobo stables are doing better than ever before. You adventurers are doin' a great job... I've never seen such fine-lookin' animals!≺Prompt≻
Here's a little token of my gratitude. I'm sure you can raise a winner!≺Prompt≻
It's thanks to you that the chocobo stables are still thriving.≺Prompt≻

I'm Finbarr, the chocoguy!≺Prompt≻
